alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Custer; Dewey; Greer; Kiowa; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Washita, northwestern Caddo, Custer, northwestern Kiowa, southwestern Blaine, southeastern Dewey and northeastern Greer Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 215 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Custer City to near Clinton to 3 miles northeast of Dill City to 4 miles southeast of Retrop. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Weatherford, Clinton, Hobart, Cordell, Burns Flat, Thomas, Hydro, Sentinel, Arapaho, Dill City, Corn, Custer City, Gotebo, Bessie, Rocky, Colony, Cloud Chief, Fay, and Cowden. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 59 and 96. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Blaine; Caddo; Custer; Dewey; Greer; Kiowa; Washita
